FRS_Method: GPS CARRIER PHASE STATIC RELATIVE POSITION

_exec_summary.SummaryText:
EXECUTIVE SUMMARY

FOR FURTHER INFORMATION OR AN EMERGENCY CONTACT:  LOCATION MANAGER Telephone 319-394-3990.

  THIS LOCATION WAS DE-REGISTERED IN 2000 BECAUSE THE BUSINESS WAS CLOSED. PRIOR TO OPENING THE FACILITY THIS FALL  A CONTRACTOR THAT IS HIGHLY REGARDED BY INDUSTRY AND THE FERTILIZER BUREAU OF THE IOWA DEPARTMENT OF AGRICULTURE AND LAND STEWARDSHIP INSPECTED THE STORAGE TANKS, PLUMBING, AND PUMP. REPAIRS OR REPLACEMENTS WERE MADE TO ALL ITEMS THAT WERE NOT SATISFACTORY. THE STORAGE TANK, PLUMBING, AND PUMP WERE THEN INSPECTED BY A REPRESENTATIVE OF THE IOWA DEPARTMENT OF AGRICULTURE AND LAND STEWARDSHIP, FERTILIZER BUREAU AND FOUND TO BE IN PROPER CONDITION FOR SAFE OPERATION.
                                                                                                                                                                                            I. THE FACILITY POLICY

   A. THE OWNER, MANAGEMENT, AND EMPLOYEES OF UAP Distribution, Inc., MEDIAPOLIS, IOWA ARE COMMITTED TO THE PREVENTION OF ANY ACCIDENTAL RELEASE OF ANHYDROUS AMMONIA. IF AN ACCIDENTAL RELEASE SHOULD OCCUR, THE FACILITY IS PREPARED TO WORK WITH THE LOCAL FIRE DEPARTMENT, LEPC, OR OTHER AUTHORITIES, TO MITIGATE ANY RELEASE AND TO MINIMIZE THE IMPACT OF THE RELEASE ON PEOPLE AND THE ENVIRONMENT.

II. FACILITY INFORMATION

   A. THE PRIMARY ACTIVITY AT THE FACILITY IS THE STORAGE AND HANDLING OF ANHYDROUS AMMONIA FOR SALE TO FARMERS.

   B. ANHYDROUS AMMONIA IS RECEIVED, STORED, AND DISTRIBUTED FOR APPLICATION ON CROPS AS FERTILIZER NUTRIENT.

   C. THE MAXIMUM QUANTITY STORED WOULD BE WOULD BE 409,296 POUNDS. NURSE TANKS  WOULD CONTAIN 164,156 POUNDS AND 245,140 POUNDS IN ONE 30,000  AND ONE 26,000 GALLON STORAGE TANKS. *NOTE: MAXIMUM QUANTITY ALLOWED TO BE STORED IS 85% OF TANK SIZE.

III. THE ACIDENTAL RELEASE, PREVENTION PROGRAM
A. THE FACILITY HAS IMPLEMENTED THE PROVISIONS OF THE SAFEY REQUIREMENTS FOR THE STORAGE AND HANDLING OF ANHYDROUS AMMONIA, K-61.1, PUBLISHED BY THE

AMERICAN NATIONAL STANDARDS INSTITUTE INC. 
    
   B. THE FACILITY HAS IMPLEMENTED THE STANDARDS OF THE U.S. OCCUPATIONAL SAFETY AND HEALTH ADMINISTRATION (OSHA) 29 CFR 1910.111, STORAGE AND HANDLING OF ANHYDROUS AMMONIA.

IV. THE FIVE YEAR ACCIDENT HISTORY

   A. THERE HAVE BEEN NO ACCIDENTAL RELEASES OF ANHYDROUS AMMONIA THAT HAVE CAUSED ANY DEATH, INJURIES, OR SIGNIFICANT PROPERTY DAMAGE AT THE FACILITY, NOR HAVE RESULTED IN OFF SITE DEATHS, INJURIES, EVACUATIONS, SHELTERING IN PLACE, PROPERTY DAMAGE, OR ENVIRONMENTAL DAMAGE. 

V. THE EMERGENCY RESPONSE PROGRAM

  A. THE FACILITY HAS A WRITTEN EMERGENCY ACTION PLAN, IN ACCORDANCE WITH OSHA STANDARD 29 CFR 1910.38. IN THE CASE OF AN UNCONTROLED RELEASE, LOCATION PERSONNEL WOULD NOTIFY AUTHORITIES AND EVACUATE. EMPLOYEES HAVE REVIEWED THE EMERGENCY RESPONSE PROGRAM  INCLUDING PRE-EMERGENCY PLANNING AND EMPLOYEE TRAINING.

  B. THE FACILITY HAS PROVIDED TO THE STATE AND LOCAL AUTHORITES, THE EMERGENCY PLANNING AND COMMUNITY RIGHT-TO-KNOW INFORMATION AS REQUIRED UNDER SARA TITLE III (EPCRA).

  C. THE LOCATION IS INCLUDED IN THE COMMUNITY EMERGENCY RESPONSE PLAN. 

VI. PLANNED CHANGES TO IMPROVE SAFETY

   A. SAFETY IMPROVEMENT IS AN ONGOING PROCESS AT THE FACILITY. PERIODIC EVALUATIONS ARE PERFORMED TO ASSESS THE MAINTENANCE OF SAFE CONDITIONS AND EVALUATE EMPLOYEE TRAINING. ADDITIONAL INFORMATION ON THESE EVALUATIONS AND ANY RESULTING CHANGES ARE AVAILABLE AT THE FACILITY.
